tag_list: philanthropy, philanthropist, entrepreneur, charity, online-dating, gay-activism, jonathan-crutchley
overview: Jonathan Crutchley co-founded Onlines Buddies, Inc., an internet dating and social networking website for gay men, with partner Larry Basile in 2001. The business grew from a telephone chat service for gay men in the Boston area. The company’s flagship website, MANHUNT.net, has grown throughout the United States and internationally, serving 2 million members in 100 countries. In 2009, Jonathan Crutchley was appointed Chairman of MANHUNT’s Philanthropy Committee.

milestones.source_description: Jonathan Crutchley, Manhunt Receives Neitzen Award from Free Speech Coalition

milestones.description: Online Buddies founder, Jonathan Crutchley, appointed Chairman of the newly formed Manhunt.net Philanthropy Committee to further develop the corporate giving strategy.
milestones.source_description: Online Buddies, Inc. Appoints Jonathan Crutchley Chairman of the MANHUNT Philanthropy Committee
